COMMENT_TX: $Argument about a pop single down 1B-line ensued during AB. Ump Pfirman ruled it was foul.  Giants protested to no avail.
Over RF wall into Broad Street
Hit second pitch over RF fence
Fitzsimmons forced to retire because of a painful bruise on his right hand suffered when he blocked Friberg's hard hit in the first inning.
Roush's fast fielding held hit to a double
Klein lost it in the sun
Hurst ejected by umpire Pfirman because of a scuffle RGF. Hurst apparently resented taunts hurled at him by the Giants' dugout suddenly left his position and rushed to the dugout to attack his man.
Davis pulled a charley horse sliding into 3B
Bissonette was hit in the back of the head and dropped like a felled ox.  He aroze nearly 5 minutes later and walked to 1B slowly but was too dizzy to stay in the game.
Hornsby registered his first squawk of the season claiming catcher Davis touched his bat as he swung.  Ump Hart refused to listen or ask a brother umpire.
Smashed off Willoughby's hand to Whitney
Beck: fast play on slow roller
Far and high over RF wall
Kelly trapped the infield fly and caught O'Doul off 1B. There was considerable discussion about the play but both men were ruled out.
Bounced off Greene's legs to Thompson assuming 2-3
Blank PA; assume L.Waner scored here.
Whitney rounded 1B and was out before he could return
Scratched a hit off Grantham's glove
Alexander appeared nauseous so Mgr Southworth ran out to see to him.  When a drink of water failed to restore him he was taken out (with a 2-1 count on Hurst).
Benge quick-pitched Smith as he stepped into the batter's box.  When Ump Moran called it a strike, Mgr Southworth and Coach Neale ran in to protest.  Smith was ejected by Moran.
Over RF wall (according to summary, though account says LF)
Following events gleaned from Phi Inquirer:
Smashed off Gilbert's glove and trickled into short LF where Bancroft retrieved it, catching Whitney overrunning 3B.
Had Peel doubled up, but Sisler dropped the throw.
Whitney lost it in the sun
Greene was ordered to bat for McGraw but before he got to the plate he was withdrawn.
Ott's throw home went through Hogan allowing both runners to advance.
Close play at the plate.  The runners moved up while Hogan was arguing the decision with Ump Moran.
'Lerian dropped an apparent single in short CF but Whitney was out at the plate, Roush to Hogan'.
Text noted 343/GDP, but box score had Friberg as the (more likely) pivot man.
Attempted double steal; Mays was driven back to 1B
$Mel Ott struck on the right elbow
$Joe Genewich replaced Mel Ott as a courtesy runner
$Before leaving the field Mays walked to the plate to berate Ump Moran for his judgment of strikes and balls.
Thompson knocked it down but couldn't hold on
Thevenow's 1st appearance since he was terribly injured in a car accident in the South during spring training.
Hit & run; the ball got away from Leach
Lerian: remarkable bare-hand catch in the grandstand
Orsatti lost fly in the sun
Haines appearedto be angy at his lack of support and merely lobbed the ball over for Dailey and Sothern.
Hit flagpole and bounced back onto the field
In the rundown, Douthit and Frankhouse ended up on 3B
Selph injured left leg sliding into 3B; assisted off field
Bad bounder hit Bottomley in the head
Bush's throw home was late; Benge credited with hit.
Over the new twelve-foot screen in RF
Orsatti was safe at 2B.  Jonnard thought a GDP had been completed and wandered toward the SLN bench. When he learned his mistake it was too late.
As Haines left the field he said a few words to Ump McLaughlin who ejected him.
Cardinals protested decision on play at home.  Hal Haid was ejected for his remarks from SLN dugout.
Friberg muffed the fly ball but recovered to force Thompson
Nasty bounder that bounced over Blair's head
The ball hit the top of the RF screen and bounded over
Blair dropped high pop fly but got the force
Into the back part of LCF bleachers
McMillan's wild throw rolled into RF
Whitney threw to Thompson too late & high
Holm let the ball get away from him
Threw past High into PHI dugout
Adams started to cover 2B as Brame delivered the ball.  The easy grounder went through the vacated SS hole.
Over O'Doul's head as he leaped for it
Smythe trapped Moore off 2B and tagged him out
Frederick's 51st double set a new NL record.
Dave Bancroft (3B coach) ejected by Ump Hart after he had protested a called foul ball from Warner's bat.
